definition: respect the old and cherish the young
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
young

sentences.english: Respecting the old and caring for the young is a traditional Chinese virtue.
sentences.chinese: 尊老爱幼是中华民族的传统美德。

sentences.english: I'm a 70-year-old, for goodness' sake. It was bang out of order.
sentences.chinese: 我是70岁的老人了，你还有没有点尊老爱幼的传统？

sentences.english: A Some people find it’s very meaningful to be kind to the young and care for the old.
sentences.chinese: 一些人觉得尊老爱幼很有意义。

sentences.english: To respect the old and to love the young are good moral habits.
sentences.chinese: 尊老爱幼是良好的道德风尚。

sentences.english: Respecting the elders and loving the young is one of the traditional Chinese virtues.
sentences.chinese: 尊老爱幼是中华民族的传统美德之一。

sentences.english: Everyone should respect the elderly and care for the young.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都应该做到尊老爱幼。

sentences.english: Respect the old and love the young, offer help and kindness as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 尊老爱幼，尽可能的向别人提供力所能及的帮助。

sentences.english: Have you ever heard “respect the aged and love the young”? Be polite, please.
sentences.chinese: 你听说过尊老爱幼吗？请礼貌一点。

sentences.english: In a word，respect the old and love the young.

definition: respect the aged
to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
respect for the aged
pleasure from helping others (idiom)

virtue

filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
filial piety and fraternal duty
hardworking and thrifty in running one's household

to modestly decline
benevolent father, filial son (idiom)/natural love between parents and children
diligent and thrifty (idiom)
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
